name: I'm Seeing Starmen! Trivia Game | Comics | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Ted Knight.

	Ted Knight was an astronomer who invented a special rod that allowed him the power of flight. He defended Opal City from crime and served with the Justice Society of America.

True.

	Tomas is an alien who has a gem embedded in his chest. This gem gives him the power of flight and the ability to fire bolts of energy. He later traveled with Jack Knight.

options: It was natural to his race
questions.explanation:
Special armbands.

	Prince Gavyn, an alien ruler, wore armbands that gave him the ability to fly and shoot energy bolts. He once teamed up with Superman and was originally believed to have died during the Crises on Infinite Earths.

questions.text: What power did Will Payton not have?
options: The ability to fire energy bolts
questions.explanation:
Precognition.

	Will Payton was an ordinary human who was struck by a lightning bolt from outer space. Turned into a kind of human fusion reactor, Payton took the name Starman and fought crime.

questions.text: Jack Knight killed the son of this villain.
questions.explanation:
The Mist.

	The Mist is an old rival of the first Starman, Ted Knight. Ted's son, Jack, later reluctantly becomes Starman and kills The Mist's son out of a desire to ensure his father's safety.

He sacrifices himself.

	From a 853rd Century, Farris Knight is a descendant of the Knight famiyl as well as a descendant of The Mist. A member of Justice Legion A, he changes sides and helps the evil Solaris. Repenting, he gives his life to defeat Solaris.

questions.text: Thom Kallor has the power to increase the mass of an object.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Kallor also had temporary powers similar to those of Superboy, but eventually lost them. He became Starman in the "Kingdom Come" miniseries.

questions.text: One person to adopt the mantle of Starman was a schizophrenic.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Introduced in the seventh issue of "Infinite Crisis", this new Starman joined a new Justice Society of America. He lives in a mental institution, but leaves to save people.

questions.text: Which Starman is a rape victim?
questions.explanation:
Jack Knight.

	Jack Knight was raped by Nash, the daughter of The Mist, an old Starman villain. She later gave birth to Jack's son as a result of the rape. Another hero who has been raped is Nightwing.

questions.text: Which Starman has been in a homosexual relationship?
questions.explanation:
Mikaal Tomas.

	This was revealed in the 1990's "Starman" series, when Jack Knight was Starman. He went into space to find Will Payton, and took Mikaal Tomas with him.
